net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.comm
Class RS232Monitor

java.lang.Object
  net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.comm.BaseMonitor
      net.sourceforge.JDash.ecu.comm.RS232Monitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable, ECUMonitor
Direct Known Subclasses:
ELMScanMonitor, KWP2000Monitor, NissanConsultMonitor, SSMOBD1Monitor, SSMOBD2Monitor
public abstract class RS232Monitor
extends BaseMonitor

If your concrete monitor uses some sort of serial rs232 protocol, then you'll likely want to extend this monitor. Only because it provides a number of methods that are usefull for reading and writing serial bytes to a serial port. Although the ELMScan module uses an RS232 serial interface, it's not the same thing as this monitor. This class will send and receive specially formatted packets. The ELMScan module responds to standard modem AT commands, and a simple sending and receive to text strings. Use the ELMScanMonitor instead. Usefull Links http://obddiagnostics.com/obdinfo/msg_struct.html

Constructor Detail

RS232Monitor

public RS232Monitor(int serialBaud,
                    int data,
                    int parity,
                    int stop)
             throws java.lang.Exception
Create a new instance of an RS232Monitor.

Parameters:
rxEchosTx - IN - this indicates that the ecu at the other end of the serial port will echo our TX packet back on the RX packet. This TX echo will be stripped from the RX packet before it's returned in the sendPacket() method. The default RX Timeout will be set to a value of 1000ms.
serialBaud - IN - the default BAUD rate to set the serial port to.
data - IN - The data bits, use the constants from RXTXPort
parity - IN - the parity state, use the constants from RXTXPort
stop - IN - the stop bit, use the constatns from RXTXPOrt
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

closePort

protected void closePort()
                  throws java.lang.Exception
Close the io streams and the port, and set the internal port variable to null. The next call to getPort() will result in the re-opening of the port.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getPort

protected gnu.io.RXTXPort getPort()
                           throws java.lang.Exception
This function will create and return the RXTX Serial Port. The first call to this method will create the port, all following calls will return the originally created one. The BAUD rate of the port is set with the value passed into the constructor. If you need to do anything out of the ordinary for serial port generation, then override this method, and go to town. Note, other than the data/parity/stop bit settings, the only thing done to this port is to set the flowcontrol to NONE>

Returns:
the serial port.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

calcCheckSum

protected static byte calcCheckSum(byte[] byteArray)
Calculate the checksum value for the given byte array

Parameters:
b -
Returns:

breakConnection

protected void breakConnection()
The sendPacket method sets up a monitor timer to watch for the IO port timeint out on the TX/RX sequence. If the timer fires, it will call this method. Here, we'll not only break the connection, but also close the port.

readBytes

protected byte[] readBytes(java.io.InputStream is,
                           int numBytes)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
Read the EXACT number of bytes from the input stream as identified in the numBytes value. This method will wait on the InputSTream until atleast the numBytes of byte are available. Then EXACTLY that number of bytes will be read. No more, no less. The return byte[] will be the bytes you requested.

Parameters:
is - IN - the input stream to read from.
bytes - IN - the number of bytes to read.
Returns:
the read bytes.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - If there was a problem reading the byes. Like the read timed out.
